Description:
Construction Procedure
Contractor has to submit construction procedure that including but not limited to
 Quarry Registration Certificates
 Aggregate production procedure
 Mix design
 Laying procedure
 Repair of surface defects

Aggregate Production Procedure
Contractor has to submit construction procedure that including but not limited to
 Area of the quarry from which the material in the lot will be won
 Production procedure and method of winning of the material
 Stockpile management procedure including traceability as part of lot control
 Quality Control Procedures

Quarry Registration Certificate
Contractor has to submit quarry registration certificate for aggregate supply at least seven (7) working days prior to material supply or use.

Construction Procedure
Contractor has to submit construction procedures at least seven (7) days prior to commencement of aggregate production

Supply and usage of aggregate material
Quarry materials shall only be supplied or used on site only after meeting the below check points
 Quarry registration certificate received and verified for material testing frequencies
 Construction procedures received and approved for construction.
 Changes to material supply/quarry shall be submitted and approved prior to supply/use on site.

Mix Design Assessment and Certification
Contractor has to submit construction procedures at least seven (7) days prior to commencement of slurry production
 Identity and address of the registered slurry manufacturer
 Constituent material test certificates from NATA accredited test laboratory
 Mix Design approval certificate from TMR

Mix Design Assessment and Certification
All relevant documents for slurry production have to be reviewed and approved at least seven (7) days prior to slurry production

Mix Design Constituent material requirements
Aggregate


Mineral Filler
Filler shall consist of Portland Cement, hydrated lime or fly ash with minimum 85% passing a 0.075mm test sieve. Free from lumps, clay and other deleterious material
Binder - Shall be bituminous emulsion (polymer modified for micro-surfacing)
Water - Shall be potable and free from any deleterious material
Additives - shall be TMR approved product
Mix Design Criteria - Grading (Combined aggregate and mineral filler)
Mix Design Criteria - Maximum permissible Grading variation
Mix Design Criteria - Bituminous slurry mix properties

Plant and Equipment
 Paving Unit - Must be calibrated to the proposed mix design prior to construction.
 Other plants including but not limited to rotary brooms, signs, lamps, barricades, hand squeegees, shovels and hand brooms, shall meet all statutory requirements.

Laying/Surfacing Procedure
Contractor has to submit slurry mix laying procedure at least seven (7) days prior to surfacing operation detailing below.
 Approved Plant and Equipment including calibration
 Laying program
 Details of any preliminary Trial
 ITP
 Any specific surfacing treatment

Laying/Surfacing Procedure
Laying/surfacing operation shall be submitted and approved at least seven (7) days prior to surfacing operation.

Setout
Marks shall be placed on the existing surface at intervals not exceeding 10m on the line to be followed by the paving unit while laying the slurry.

Cleaning existing surface
Laying of bituminous slurry shall not commence until
 The existing pavement has been swept
 The surface is free of loose material, stones, dirt, dust and foreign matter.

Protection of existing services
 Protect services (pits, drains, pipes etc.,) against asphalt spilling
 No traffic until the process has been completed
 Remove all waste asphalt and clean job site

Surface Defects
Prior to laying/surfacing surface defects (if any identified or stated in annexure) shall be repaired including but not limited to 
 Crack filling
 Pothole repairs
 Repairs to failed pavement

Tack Coat
 If stated in Annexure or applicable bituminous emulsion tack coat shall be applied prior to surfacing operation.
 Tack coat shall be left to break and harden prior to the laying operation

Water fog Coat
The surface may be pre-wet by fogging ahead of the spreader box. The application rate of the fog spray shall be adjusted to suit temperature, surface texture, humidity and dryness of the surface being covered.

Weather conditions/limitations
1) DO NOT PROCEED - If EITHER of pavement or air temperature is below 10°C and falling
2) DO NOT PROCEED - during rain or when rain is imminent.
3) MAY PROCEED - If BOTH of pavement or air temperature is above 7°C and rising

Rut-filling (Ruts > 15mm in depth)
 Fill the ruts prior to laying/surfacing
 Rut-filling mix design shall be proposed and approved or as per annexure MRTS13.1 Cl 3

Spreading Process
 Slurry shall be of desired consistency prior to loading into spreader box
 May add minor amount of water to overcome build-up slurry in the corners of the spreader box
 Ensure enough mix available to maintain full width of the strike-off which shall be adjusted to provide uniform spreading thus to achieve uniform thickness.

Surface Texture/Finish (Trial run-Witness point)
 Perform short test run to demonstrate desired surface texture prior to full scale manufacture and laying of production slurry
 Trail pre-dampened hessian or fabric skirt behind the spreader box across the full width to increase the surface texture where specified.
 Clean the hessian or fabric to maintain its flexibility

Shape (Straight Edge)
The finished surface of the final wearing course shall not vary by more than two-thirds of the original average maximum deviation from a three metre straightedge.

Joints
 Longitudinal joints shall be at the edge of the lane or at the centre of the lane.
 Square off the edges across full width at the end of each shift

Traffic Time
Bituminous slurry shall be capable of carrying slow moving traffic (less than 40 km/h) within one hour of application without undue permanent damage occurring, such as rutting or ravelling. When the traffic time exceeds one hour, work shall cease.

Hand work
Areas which cannot be reached with the spreader box shall be
 Surfaced using hand squeegees to provide uniform finish
 Lightly dampen the area or tack-coat if require
 Hand work finish shall be uniform and match the adjacent machine finish

Clean up
 Surplus slurry shall be removed
 Clean up stockpile site and/or loading area and restore to its original condition.

Lot size
Number of lots on a completed day's productivity shall be greater than one of the below 
 One lot per 25 m? of completed surfacing
 2 lots per day's productivity.

Testing frequencies and number of tests
At least 2 samples are selected and tested from each lot to comply the bituminous slurry surfacing.

Geometrics
The geometric tolerances, except for surface evenness, shall be checked by a method of random stratified sampling.

Bituminous Emulsion
2 Samples (2 litres each) per bulk delivery of bituminous emulsion to be taken.
If problems are experienced or suspected with the bituminous emulsion, the samples shall be tested for compliance with MRTS21.

Bituminous Slurry
2 Samples (1.5 Kgs each) per lot to be taken at random intervals.
The samples shall be tested for residual binder content and particle size distribution in accordance with Test Method Q308C.

Supplementary requirements
The requirements of MRTS13 Bituminous Slurry Surfacing are varied by the supplementary requirements given in Clause 4 of Annexure MRTS13.1.

Lot Closure
 All compliance met requirements
 All Test results received, reviewed and approved
 All NCRs actioned
Records:
Correspondence
Verification Checklist
Product certificates
Test reports
